title: Spiced Chicken Wings
ingredients: Flat leaf parsley sprig, for the garnish
2-inch piece of fresh ginger, peeled and chopped
The juice and finely grated zest of 2 limes
instructions: Place the marinade ingredients in a food processor or blender and blend until it’s smooth.  Place the chicken in a bowl and pour the marinade over it.  Toss, cover and leave it to marinate for 1 to 2 hours,

To make the dip, put the peppers under a preheated broiler for 10 minutes, turning them occasionally until they are charred and blistered.  Remove them from the heat source and place them in a plastic bag until cool.  Then peel off the skin and remove the seeds and white membrane.  Put the flesh in a food processor, or blender, with the yogurt and blend until smooth.  Pour into a bowl, season with the soy sauce and pepper to taste then stir in the cilantro.  Cover and chill until needed.
Remove the chicken from the marinade and cook under a preheated broiler or on a barbecue grill for 4 to 5 minutes on each side, basting with the remaining marinade.
Place the chicken in a serving bowl and garnish with flat leaf parsley.  Serve the chicken immediately with the dip and lime wedges.
Remarks:  Erick has made this dish and recommends that we use chicken tenders (boneless, skinless, chicken breasts cut into 1-inch thick strips) instead.
Source:  Time to Celebrate!  Food & Ideas for Parties by Hamlyn, a division of Octopus Publishing Group Ltd, 2 –4 Heron Quays, London E14 4JP, ©1999, 2001 by Octopus Publishing Group Ltd.
